toilet.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a large bowl that you sit on to get rid of waste liquid or waste matter from your body
toilet.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: He flushed the toilet (=pulled the handle so that water ran into the toilet to clean it).
toilet.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a room or building containing a toilet
toilet.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the act of washing and dressing yourself
toilet.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: He got up to go to the toilet in the middle of the night.
Does anyone need the toilet before we set off?
I heard someone flush the toilet.
He set off across the square in search of a public toilet.
The house was small, with no hot water and an outside toilet.
Many cottages lacked a bathroom or indoor toilet.
Toilet facilities are available at the bus station.
He always left the toilet seat up.
She was scrubbing the toilet bowl.
toilet.translation[0].note_box[1].sectio: a room with a toilet in it, in someone’s house or in a public place
He locked himself in the toilet.
the public toilets
bathroom
a room with a toilet in it, in someone’s house. In British English, bathroom is used especially when you want to be polite. In American English, it is the usual word to use
He asked to use the bathroom.
restroom
a room in a public place that has one or more toilets in it
She went into the store to use the restroom.
lavatory

a room with a toilet in it. In American English lavatory is used mainly for toilets in a public building or on a plane. In British English it is used both about public toilets and toilets in people’s houses
public lavatories
He didn’t have time to visit the lavatory.
loo
a room with a toilet in it. Loo is very common in everyday spoken British English
‘Where’s Chris?’ ‘He’s in the loo.’
Can I use your loo?
Where’s the john?
bog
a very informal word for a toilet, which is not considered polite
The nearest bog was miles away.
the ladies
a public toilet for women
Where’s the ladies?
I need to go to the ladies’ room.
the gents
a public toilet for men
I followed him into the gents.
I’ve got to go to the men’s room. Excuse me.
latrine
an outdoor toilet in a camp or military area
The latrines were in a shocking state.
urinal
a type of toilet for men that is attached to a wall
He was standing at the urinal.
potty
a bowl that babies use as a toilet
Does he need his potty?
commode
a chair with a bowl in it, used as a toilet, especially in hospitals and homes for old people
She has to use a commode.
bedpan
a container which is used as a toilet, especially in hospitals by people who are too ill or weak to get out of bed
I had to change the bedpans.
